labelLink.label: General Information [Abstract]
General information about the auditee and auditor.
Fiscal Period [Abstract]
Information about the fiscal period of the audit.
Fiscal Period Start Date
First date of the fiscal period covered by the audit.
Fiscal Period End Date
Last date of the fiscal period covered by the audit.
Type of Audit [Abstract]
Information about the type of Uniform Guidance Audit.
Uniform Audit Guidance Type

Indicate if the Uniform Guidance Audit is Single Audit or Program-specific Audit. 2 CFR 200.501 of the Uniform Guidance requires non-Federal entities that expend $750,000 or more in a year in Federal awards to have a single audit conducted, except when they elect to have a program-specific audit conducted in accordance with 2 CFR 200.507.
Audit Period [Abstract]
Information about the period covered by the audit.
Audit Period Covered

Report as Annual, Biennial, or Other. Annual audits cover 12 months and biennial audits cover 24 months. If the audit period covered is neither annual nor biennial, report as "Other" and indicate the number of months by using the element AuditPeriodCoveredMonths.
GRM Legal Entity Audit Period Covered Quantity
Number of months covered in the audit. To be used only if audit is other than annual or biennial.
Auditee Identification Numbers [Abstract]
Information about identification numbers for the auditee.
Auditee Employer Identification Number
The Tax Identification Number (TIN), also known as an Employer Identification Number (EIN), for the auditee. This is a unique 9-digit value assigned by the IRS.
Multiple Employer Tax Identifications

Indicates if the auditee (or components of an auditee covered by the audit) was assigned more than one EIN by the IRS. For example, a statewide audit covers many departments, each of which may have its own EIN). If there is more than one EIN, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. If there is more than one EIN number, use the Auditee EIN Continuation List [Table] to collect information about additional EIN numbers.
Auditee Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) Number

The DUNS number is a unique nine-digit identification sequence assigned by Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) (available from the D&B DUNS registration hotline at 866-705-5711). A DUNS number is required when applying for a Federal grant on Grants.gov or any other application method.
Multiple DUNS Numbers

Indicates if the auditee (or components of an auditee covered by the audit) was assigned more than one DUNS number. If there is more than one DUNS, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. If there is more than one DUNS number, use the Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Table] to collect information about additional DUNS numbers.
Auditee Information [Abstract]
Information about the auditee.
Auditee Name
Name of the auditee associated with the primary EIN. When possible, this name should match to the name assigned to the primary EIN by the IRS.
Auditee Address Street Address
Street address of the auditee.
Auditee Address City
City of the auditee street address.
Auditee Address State
State of the auditee street address.
Auditee Address Zip Code
Zip code of the auditee street address.
Auditee Contact Name
Auditee Contact Name.
Auditee Contact Title
Auditee Contact Title.
Auditee Contact Phone
Auditee Contact Phone.
Auditee Contact Email
Auditee Contact Email.
Primary Auditor Information [Abstract]
Information about the primary auditor.
Primary Auditor Name
Name of the primary auditor associated with the primary EIN. When possible, this name should match to the name assigned to the primary EIN by the IRS.
Primary Auditor Address Street Address
Street address of the primary auditor.
Primary Auditor Address City
City of the primary auditor street address.
Primary Auditor Address State
State of the primary auditor street address.
Primary Auditor Address Zip Code
Zip code of the primary auditor street address.
Primary Auditor Contact Name
Primary auditor contact name.
Primary Auditor Contact Title
Primary auditor contact title.
Primary Auditor Contact Phone
Primary auditor contact phone.
Primary Auditor Contact Email
Primary auditor contact email.
Secondary Auditor Used
Indicates whether multiple auditors contributed to the audit. If there is, report value of TRUE; if there is not, FALSE.
Secondary Auditor Information [Abstract]
Information about the Secondary auditor.
Secondary Auditor Name
Name of the secondary auditor associated with the secondary EIN. When possible, this name should match to the name assigned to the secondary EIN by the IRS.
Secondary Auditor Address Street Address
Street address of the secondary auditor.
Secondary Auditor Address City
City of the secondary auditor street address.
Secondary Auditor Address State
State of the secondary auditor street address.
Secondary Auditor Address Zip Code
Zip code of the secondary auditor street address.
Secondary Auditor Contact Name
Secondary auditor contact name.
Secondary Auditor Contact Title
Secondary auditor contact title.
Secondary Auditor Contact Phone
Secondary auditor contact phone.
Secondary Auditor Contact Email
Secondary auditor contact email.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Abstract]
Information about additional auditee DUNS numbers.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Table]
Table used to capture information about Auditee DUNS Continuation Lists.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Axis]

Used to identify multiple DUNS numbers for additional auditees. If the value TRUE was reported for the concept MultipleDUNSNumbers, use this axis which is a typed dimension along with the concept AuditeeDUNSNumber. Report a DUNS number using this table if it identies a component entity (e.g., State Agency, sub-entity) of the auditee with Federal awards expended during the fiscal period included in the audit. Do not include separate DUNS numbers for any compnent entity that did not expend or otherwise administer Federal awards.
Auditee DUNS Continuation List [Line Items]
Used to collect information about Auditee DUNS Continuation Lists.
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Abstract]
Information about additional auditee EIN numbers.
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Table]
Table used to capture information about Auditee EIN Continuation Lists.
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Axis]

Used to identify multiple EIN numbers for additional auditees. If the value TRUE was reported for the concept MultipleEmployeeTaxIdentification, use this axis which is a typed dimension along with the concept AuditeeEmployerIdentificationNumber. Report an EIN number using this table if it identies a component entity (e.g., State Agency, sub-entity) of the auditee with Federal awards expended during the fiscal period included in the audit. Do not include separate EIN numbers for any compnent entity that did not expend or otherwise administer Federal awards.
Auditee EIN Continuation List [Line Items]
Used to collect information about Auditee EIN Continuation Lists.
Schedule of Federal Awards and Questioned Costs [Abstract]
Information about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards in the Single Audit package.
Schedule of Federal Awards and Questioned Costs [Table]
Table used to capture information about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards in the Single Audit package.
Federal Program Identifier [Axis]

Used to identify a federal program as shown in the CFDA. Use in conjunction with the elements ClusterNameEnumerated and FederalAwardingAgencyEnumerated to create XBRL contexts to associate line items to represent information about a Federal Program, such as Federal Program Name, Federal Expenditures, or CFDA Number, with a specific agency and cluster.
Schedule of Federal Awards and Questioned Costs [Line Items]

Used to collect information on the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards. To associate a line item concept with a specific cluster and federal awarding agency, use with a context including the FederalAwardingAgencyEnumerated and ClusterNameEnumerated elements.
Federal Awarding Agency [Enumerated]

Name of the Federal Awarding Agency, select from an enumerated list of existing Federal Awarding Agencies. Use in the context along with the concept ClusterNameEnumerated to define a cluster/agency combination that can be associated with line items about a specific federal program, such as Federal Program Name or CFDA number.
CFDA Number

The CFDA number is a two-digit prefix representing the Federal Awarding agency and a three digit extension separated by a period. The last three digits of the CFDA number represent the program which should be listed in the CFDA catalog. If the program is unknown, enter a "U" followed by a two-digit number in the CFDA extension to identify one or more Federal award lines that form the program. For example, the first Federal program with an unknown three-digit extension would be U01 for all award lines associated with that program, the second would be U02, and so on. If the program is part of the Research and Development cluster and the three-digit CFDA extension is unknown, enter "RD" as the three-digit extension.
Additional Award Identification

Information that can be used to identify the award, which is not a CFDA number, for example, program year, contract number, state issued numbers, etc. If the CFDA Three-Digit Extension is unknown, this is a required field.
CFDA Number
Name of the Federal program as shown in the CFDA. If not listed, this is a description of the award recognizable by the Federal awarding agency or pass-through entity.
Amount Expended
Amount of expenditures for the Federal award which may be direct funds or may be split between direct and indirect funds.
GRM Legal Entity Cluster Name

Name of the cluster, select from an enumerated list of existing cluster names. Should be used in the context along with the concept FederalAwardingAgencyEnumerated to define a cluster/agency combination that can be associated with line items about a specific federal program, such as Federal Program Name or CFDA number. If a state cluster is used, use the StateClusterName element. If the cluster is not on this enumerated list, use the OtherClusterName element.
Additional Cluster Information [Abstract]
Information about the program cluster when it is a state cluster or is not already listed.
State Cluster Name
Name of the State Cluster. Used if State Cluster was selected from ClusterNameEnumerated.
Other Cluster Name
Name of the cluster, if the cluster is not available in the concept ClusterNameEnumerated.
Loan Program [Abstract]
Information about Federal Awards that are part of a Loan Program.
Federal Loan or Loan Guarantee
Indicates whether the program is a Federal loan or a Federal loan guarantee. If it is, report as TRUE; if it is not, report as FALSE.
Outstanding Loan Balance, End of Audit Period
The amount of the loan or loan guarantee balance outstanding at the end of the audit period for loan programs as identified in Part I, Item 1(i), as required by 2 CFR 200.510(b)(5).
Federal Award Source [Abstract]
Information about the source of the Federal Award.
Direct Award

Indicates if the award was received directly from a Federal awarding agency. If funds were received directly, report as TRUE; if funds were received as a pass-through, report as FALSE. When an award consists of both direct and indirect funds, use the element AmountExpendedDirect, and AmountExpendedIndirect to represent the amounts. If an award is received directly, but then transferred to another part of the same single audit reporting entity, these awards should still be reported as direct (transfers within the single audit reporting entity do not create a pass-through entity/subrecipient relationship).
Pass-through Source Entity Name
Name of the pass-through entity for award amounts identified as not being direct, as required 2 CFR 200.510(b)(2).
Pass-through Source Entity Identifier

Identifying number assigned by the pass-through entity, for award lines identified as not being direct. The identifying number is required by 2 CFR 200.510(b)(2). If there is not an identifying number assigned by the pass-through entity, report this element as "N/A".
Passed Through [Abstract]
Information about whether awards were passed through to subrecipients.
Award Passed Through to Subrecipients
Indicates if the award was passed through to subrecipients. If awards were passed through, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Pass Through Amount
If an award was passed through to any subrecipients, the total amount provided to subrecipients for each Federal program is required (2 CFR 200.510(b)(4)).
Major Program and Audit Findings [Abstract]
Information about major programs and audit findings.
Major Program
Indicates if the Federal program is a major program as defined in 2 CFR 200.518. If it is a major program, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Type of Single Audit Opinion

Indicates the type of opinion for a Single Audit Report for a Major Program. Can be reported as Unmodified opinion (U), Qualified opinion (Q), Adverse opinion (A), or Disclaimer of opinion (D). For clusters of programs, the type of audit report must apply to the cluster as a whole, and should be reported for all programs in a cluster. If the program is not a Major Program, do not use this element.
GRM Legal Entity Audit Findings Total Quantity
A value indicating the total count of grant recipient audit findings on the Federal program as a result of the current audit. (221, augmented)
Audit Finding Reference Number
Audit findings reference number. The required format is the four-digit year, a hyphen and a three-digit number (e.g., 2019-001, 2019-002).
Audit Finding [Abstract]
Information about audit findings.
Audit Finding [Table]
Table used to capture information about audit findings.
Audit Finding Identifier [Axis]
Used to identify an audit finding associated with a federal program.
Audit Finding [Line Items]
Used to collect information about audit findings on the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs.
Federal Program Identifier [Enumerated]

Enumerated list of program identifers which corresponds to the FederalProgramIdentifierAxis. Use this concept with the AuditFindingIdentifierTable to link the audit finding to a Federal Program. Use this concept when with the FederalSubprogramIdentifierTable to link a subprogram to a primary Federal program.
Type(s) of Compliance Requirement [Abstract]
Information about the type of compliance the auditor was testing which generated the audit finding.
Compliance Requirement, Activities Allowed or Unallowed
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "activities allowed or unallowed". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Allowable Costs and Cost Principles
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "allowable costs and cost principles". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Cash Management
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "cash management". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Eligibility
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "eligibility". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Equipment and Real Property Management

Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "equipment and real property management". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Matching, Level of Effort, Earmarking
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "matching, level of effort, earmarking". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Period of Performance of Federal Funds

Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "period of performance (or availability) of Federal funds". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Procurement, Suspension, Disbarment

Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "procurement and suspension and disbarment". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Program Income
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "program income". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Reporting
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "reporting". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Reserved
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "reserved". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Subrecipient Monitoring
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "subrecipient monitoring". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Special Tests and Provisions
Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "special tests and provisions". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Requirement, Other

Indicates the type of compliance requirement being tested which generated the audit finding was not specified in Part 3 of the Compliance Supplement, and is therefore designated as "other". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Type of Audit Finding [Abstract]
Information about the type of audit findings.
Compliance Audit Findings [Abstract]
Information about compliance audit findings.
Compliance Audit Modified Opinion

Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding on the Report on Compliance for Each Major Federal Program as the basis for a Modified Opinion. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if the auditor did not, report as FALSE.
Compliance Audit Other Matters

Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding on the Report on Compliance for Each Major Federal Program as the basis for Other Matters. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if the auditor did not, report as FALSE.
Internal Control Audit Findings [Abstract]
Information about internal control audit findings.
Internal Control Audit Material Weakness
Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding in the Report on Internal Control over Compliance as a Material Weakness. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Internal Control Audit Significant Deficiency
Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding in the Report on Internal Control over Compliance as a Significant Deficiency. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Other Audit Findings
Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding as not classified under the Report on Compliance or the Report on Internal Controls. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Questioned Costs
Indicates if there were any questioned costs related to the audit finding, even if the amount cannot be determined. If there were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Repeat Finding From Prior Year
Indicates whether the audit finding is a repeat of an audit finding from the immediate prior year. If it is, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Repeat Finding Audit Reference Number
Prior year audit reference number(s) from the immediate prior audit (2 CFR 200.516(b)(8) for repeat findings identified.
Repeat Finding Audit Schedule Text
Text of the repeat finding schedule text.
Audit Finding Text
Text of the audit finding that directly corresponds to the audit finding reference number.
GRM Legal Entity Audit Corrective Action Text
A description of the planned action to be taken by the grant recipient to address audit finding. (190, augmented)

Federal Awarding Agency Totals [Line Items]
Used to represent information about total amounts reported for the Federal Awarding Agency.
Federal Subprogram Identifier [Abstract]
Information about federal programs that have separate subprograms.
Federal Subprogram Identifier [Table]
Used to collect information about subprograms.
Federal Subprogram Identifier [Axis]
Use this axis to represent federal award subprograms which are linked to a federal award program.
Federal Subprogram Identifier [Line Items]
Used to represent information about federal programs that are split into subprograms which may have separate contract numbers.
Notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards [Abstract]
Information about notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards (SEFA).
Significant Accounting Policy
Description of the significant accounting policies used in preparing the SEFA (2CFR 200.510(b)(6)).
Auditee Used De Minimis Cost Rate
Indicates if the auditee elected to use the de minimus cost rate. May be reported as Yes, No, or Both.
Title of Additional Notes to the SEFA
Title of the additional notes section in the notes to the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards.
Additional Notes
Additional notes provided about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards (SEFA), as needed.
Information About Findings and Questioned Costs [Abstract]
Information about findings and questioned costs.
Financial Statements [Abstract]
Information about the Financial Statements.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements [Abstract]
Information about the auditor's opinion of the financial statements.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Adverse

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Adverse opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Disclaimer

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Disclaimer of opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Not US GAAP

The results of the auditor's determination is that the financial statements were not prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), but were instead prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework as defined in AU-C 800 "Special Considerations - Audits of Financial Statements Prepared in Accordance with Special Purpose Framework". If so, select "Adverse opinion" as TRUE, and select this concept as TRUE. If not, report this concept as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Qualified

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Qualified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Auditor Opinion Financial Statements Unmodified

The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Unmodified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
Special Purpose Framework [Abstract]
Information about the financial statements that were prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework.
Special Purpose Framework Type
Indicates the type of Special Purpose Framework which may be Cash basis, Tax basis, Regulatory basis, Contractual basis, or Other basis.
Special Purpose Framework Required by Law

Indicates if the Special Purpose Framework used as a basis of accounting required by state law. Report as TRUE if required, report as FALSE if it was permitted by state law but not required. This will affect whether the entity can qualify as a low-risk auditee in the two subsequent audit periods (2 CFR 200.520(b)).
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Unmodified
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was unmodified.
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Qualified
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was qualified.
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Adverse
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was adverse.
Auditor Opinion Special Purpose Framework Disclaimer
Indicates if the auditor's opinion of the Special Purpose Framework was disclaimer of opinion.
Going Concern Financial Stress Paragraph in Opinion
Indicates if a "going concern" emphasis-of-matter paragraph is included in the auditor's report.
Internal Control Significant Deficiency Disclosed
Indicates if a significant deficiency in internal controls was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Internal Control Material Weakness Disclosed
Indicates if a material weakness in internal controls was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Material Noncompliance Disclosed
Indicates if material noncompliance was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Other Issues Written by Auditors

Indicates if the auditors communicated in a written document (such as a management letter) any issues that were not audit findings but warranted attention of those charged with governance in accordance with GAS 4.26 or merited the attention of management in accordance with AU-C 265.12(b). If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Federal Programs [Abstract]
Information about the Federal Programs in the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs.
Auditor Report Includes Statement on Other Units

Indicates if the auditor's report includes a statement that the auditee's financial statements include departments, agencies, or other governmental units expending $750,000 or more in Federal awards that have separate Uniform Guidance audits which are not included in this audit, per the AICPA Audit Guide. If it does, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
Grant Award Program Type A Type B Theshold Amount
A dollar amount threshold used to distinguish between Type A and Type B programs, when a recalculation of the Type A threshold is required for large loan or loan guarantees. (221)
GRM Legal Entity Low Risk Indicator
An indicator denoting the grant recipient qualifies as low-risk at the beginning of the audit period. (221)
GRM Legal Entity Audit Prior Audit Findings Indicator
An indicator denoting a grant recipient audit findings exist relating to direct Federal awards expended by Federal agency(ies) on the Summary Schedule of Prior Audit Findings report. (221, augmented)
